title: Top 3 of CFP unchanged; Tide drop, UGA to No. 4

title: Watch: Names of children killed in Gaza read out in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Manaveeyam Veedhi in Thiruvananthapuram turned into a space of remembrance on November 16. People gathered on the cultural street to read out the names of children killed in Gaza, making sure their identities were not lost in numbers. The event, called The Names of Gaza and organised by the Chinta Ravi Foundation, brought together activists, civil society members and ordinary citizens.

content: In a major step towards curbing the growing menace of drug addiction among the youth, the Karnataka State Police Department has rolled out ‘Sanmitra’ ( a good friend ), an initiative aimed at providing sustained support, rehabilitation, and monitoring for individuals struggling with substance abuse

content: A lot of devotees visit the Nithyakalyanaperumal Temple at Thiruvidanthai daily. But they are inconvenienced by lack of amenities. Chennai residents buy up land here, attracted by clean air

content: Visit comes amid talks for popular government formation; RSS chief had earlier called for peace in the State

content: Experts expressed the view that product-led growth should be the focus rather than one that relies on being the ‘back office of the world’ with millions of engineers who write codes

content: Over 68,000 teachers, anganwadi workers, noon meal works, and electricity bill readers, among others in Tamil Nadu have been deputed as Booth Level Officers

content: International Institute of Migration and Development chair S. Irudaya Rajan says there has been a rise in suicide cases of Indians in countries like Canada, where at least one migrant attempts suicide every week

title: KEONICS receives pre-orders for 1,500 units of its new AI-computer
content: KEO is Karnataka’s practical answer to the digital divide, says Priyank Kharge about the computer priced at ₹18,999

title: 2020 Delhi riot was not spontaneous but pre-planned, Solicitor General tells Supreme Court
content: Tushar Mehta says the Delhi riot was nothing less than an “attack on the sovereignty of the nation” and the version of spontaneity being peddled is a “myth”

title: Kerala B.Tech students develop ‘EVM Track’ software for State Election Commission
content: Aashin C. Anil and Jeswin Sunsi were felicitated by State Election Commissioner A. Shajahan for their contribution to the electoral process

title: Separate Section created in DPDP Rules for persons with disabilities
content: In the draft rule regarding consent mechanism, persons with disabilities had been clubbed with children; activists hail separation of Sections in the notified rules, but raise concern over lack of clarity on laws of guardianship

title: Think Bengaluru traffic is bad? Try controlling it
content: The Hindu reporter gets an opportunity to man one of Bengaluru’s busiest traffic junctions during the morning peak hour.

title: 'Venomous rhetoric': Citizens pen letter against Rahul; accuse Cong of making unsubstantiated claims
content: A group of 272 eminent citizens, including retired judges, bureaucrats, and military officers, have penned an open letter criticizing Rahul Gandhi and the Congress for allegedly undermining constitutional bodies, particularly the Election Commission. The letter accuses the opposition of baseless rhetoric and "systematic and conspiratorial attacks" against the ECI, urging civil society to support the institution.

title: Bihar: Nitish chosen leader of JD(U) legislature party; NDA set to form govt on November 20
content: JDU chief Nitish Kumar was chosen as the legislature party leader in Patna, while the BJP picked Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Sinha as its leaders. With JDU’s improved numbers and two new allies in the NDA, talks are underway on power-sharing, including demands for a deputy CM and the Speaker’s post.

title: 'Suicide haram in Islam': Owaisi reacts to Delhi blast bomber's video; slams 'martyrdom' talk
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday condemned a video of Delhi blast accused Umar Nabi justifying suicide bombings, stating suicide is haram in Islam and killing innocents is a grave sin. Owaisi also questioned Union Home Minister Amit Shah about the attack's detection, asking about the origin of the group.

title: Trump sanctions a 'crude' shock! Russia oil to India drops by 66%
content: US sanctions on Russian oil giants Rosneft and Lukoil have significantly impacted India's crude imports, with shipments plummeting by 66% in November. Refineries are now wary of US penalties, leading to reduced new orders and expedited existing ones. This shift forces Russian exporters to adopt more opaque shipping methods to navigate sanctions.

title: ‘Curse of ChatGPT’: Oracle’s $300B wipeout since OpenAI pact
content: Oracle's market value has plummeted by over $300 billion since its September partnership with OpenAI, sparking concerns of a 'Curse of ChatGPT.' Investors are questioning the debt-fueled AI infrastructure bet, which makes Oracle a proxy for OpenAI's ambitions. This decline contrasts with stable benchmarks, highlighting significant investor unease over the aggressive AI gamble.

title: Exclusive: 'He is not a machine'; Bhuvneshwar opens up about workload management
content: In an era where T20 leagues dominate ambition and injuries dictate careers, India’s seasoned swing bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar in an exclusive interview with the TimesofIndia.com opens up with rare clarity about swing bowling’s future, why workload management is misunderstood, how young pacers should think, and why Test cricket will soon become a conscious career choice.

title: Ind vs SA: Gautam Gambhir to be removed as head coach? Sourav Ganguly drops blunt verdict
content: Sourav Ganguly clarified Eden Gardens' pitch preparation, stating BCCI curators took charge four days prior to the India-South Africa Test. He admitted the surface wasn't ideal for the Indian batting lineup. Curator Sujan Mukherjee confirmed he prepared the wicket as per team management's request, with Gautam Gambhir reportedly wanting such a pitch.

title: Watch: Rohini Acharya slams journalist for saying 'married daughters' remark; video viral
content: Rohini Acharya, daughter of Lalu Prasad, strongly criticized a journalist's remark that married daughters shouldn't spend much time at their parents' home. She also condemned accusations of profiting from her kidney donation to her father, urging critics to donate themselves instead.

title: AI godfather Yann LeCun: ChatGPT tech is wrong ; leaving Meta to prove it
content: Meta's chief AI scientist Yann LeCun, a Turing Award winner and one of the godfathers of AI, says large language models powering ChatGPT and similar chatbots are fundamentally flawed and will never achieve human-level intelligence. He's leaving Meta to launch a startup focused on "world models," which learn through visual data like humans do. LeCun argues current AI systems are less intelligent than cats and warns the industry's $100+ billion LLM investment is misguided, marking a dramatic split from his employer's strategy.

title: IND vs SA: 'Leave your ego in the dressing room'- Gavaskar tears into India’s approach
content: Following India's Test defeat to South Africa, Sunil Gavaskar urged management and selectors to prioritize proven domestic performers over limited-overs all-rounders. He stressed Test cricket demands specialists, patience, and discipline, not players selected on ego or short-term form. Gavaskar highlighted the need for batters accustomed to home conditions and warned against conflating limited-overs needs with Test expectations.

title: 'Oh, we’re making a lot of progress, huh?’: Trump’s exchange with Palestinian journalist — watch
content: US President Donald Trump claimed Palestinians “liked” him and were “doing well” while speaking alongside Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman at the White House. He also said Gaza was now “much safer.” His remarks came as Hamas rejected a UN-backed US resolution based on Trump’s 20-point Gaza peace plan.

title: AI data centres on Moon: Jeff Bezos, Elon Musk, Sundar Pichai to lead
content: Tech titans are eyeing space, even the Moon, for massive AI data centres due to Earth's energy crunch and regulations. Leaders like Bezos and Musk envision unlimited solar power and natural cooling, overcoming terrestrial limitations. This shift signals a potential multi-planet infrastructure strategy to fuel future AI growth, moving beyond science fiction into corporate planning.

title: Andhra Pradesh: PM Modi offers prayers at Sri Sathya Sai Baba’s Mahasamadhi — video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Puttaparthi, Andhra Pradesh, to honor spiritual leader Sri Sathya Sai Baba's birth centenary. He paid homage at the Mahasamadhi, released a commemorative coin and postal stamps, and later traveled to Coimbatore to inaugurate the South India Natural Farming Summit and release the 21st installment of PM-KISAN.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill travels to Guwahati; management to take late call on participation
content: India's Test captain Shubman Gill is set to join the team in Guwahati for the second Test against South Africa, commencing November 22. Despite a neck injury sustained during the Kolkata Test, Gill's condition has improved, and the BCCI medical team has cleared his travel.

title: Candace Owens sparks chaos with new Britney trafficking claim as Lou Taylor trends
content: Britney Spears shared a heartwarming Instagram video with Kim and Khloé Kardashian, sparking viral attention. Simultaneously, Candace Owens leveled serious accusations on her podcast, alleging Lou Taylor's manipulative control over Britney and other stars, citing an insider email and historical patterns of financial and media exploitation. Owens' claims, though unproven, have ignited significant discussion.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Cardinals coach assesses recovery amid slump
content: Arizona Cardinals running back Trey Benson, who replaced an injured James Conner, is sidelined with a brutal knee injury sustained in Week 5. Despite initial hopes for a Week 10 return, his recovery timeline remains unclear. Head coach Jonathan Gannon stated Benson is progressing but not yet ready to play, marking his sixth missed game.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Thaw in ties? Musk at Trump's dinner with Saudi prince; video shows prez giving him brief tap
content: Elon Musk's appearance at a White House dinner with President Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman suggests a potential thawing of their recent feud. This comes after Musk publicly criticized Trump and hinted at his involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, a stark contrast to his earlier support.

title: Watch: Dancer slapped, dragged and hit with stick at Haryana wedding
content: A dancer was assaulted at a pre-wedding event in Nuh, Haryana, after objecting to inappropriate behavior from a groom's relative. The performer, Payal Choudhary, was attacked on stage when she pushed away a man's hand holding currency notes. The assault escalated, with multiple individuals joining in, and other dancers and an intervener were also beaten.

title: Running 10+, 15+ year-old vehicle? Fitness test fees updated: Prices, details
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has revised vehicle fitness test fees with a new age-based structure, lowering the threshold for higher charges to 10 years. Fees now increase across three age brackets: 10-15 years, 15-20 years, and over 20 years, impacting all vehicle categories.

title: Who is Dak Prescott’s fiancée? Meet Sarah Jane Ramos and her $1M ring
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott and fiancée Sarah Jane Ramos are embracing parenthood with their two daughters, Margaret Jane Rose and Aurora Rayne. Ramos, a former wine industry professional with a passion for hockey, has been a steadfast partner through Prescott's career highs and personal milestones. Their growing family signifies a strong bond and shared commitment.

title: NASA to unveil rare imagery of interstellar comet 3I ATLAS on 19 November 2025
content: NASA is set to unveil stunning new images of the rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, a visitor from another star system. Discovered earlier this year, this marks only the third such object observed in our solar system. The live event will offer insights into its journey and composition, providing a unique glimpse into distant cosmic environments.

title: Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha announce their baby boy's name
content: Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha have revealed the name of their newborn son, Neer, nearly a month after his birth. The couple shared a tender photo and a poetic explanation for the name, which means 'pure, divine, limitless.' Celebrities and fans have sent warm wishes following the announcement.

title: Non-smokers beware: Doctors debunk deadliest misconceptions on World COPD Day
content: Leading Indian lung specialists are sounding an alarm about Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.  COPD is now affecting younger, non-smoking individuals.  Rising pollution and lifestyle changes are driving this surge.  Experts highlight overlooked early symptoms and daily habits crucial for lung health.  This shift demands greater awareness and proactive lung care for everyone.

title: 2nd Test: Uncertainty over Gill; Reddy rejoins team as Sudharsan, Padikkal step up in nets
content: Shubman Gill's potential absence due to a neck injury poses a significant challenge for India's second Test against South Africa. Sai Sudharsan and Devdutt Padikkal are prime contenders to replace him, though the team faces a dilemma with their left-handed batting. Nitish Kumar Reddy's recall also fuels speculation about team changes.

title: ‘Attempt to flaunt patriotism’: Ricin terror-plot accused attacked in jail; assaulted by 3 inmates
content: A terror accused, Syed Ahmed Mohiuddin Abdul Qader Jilani, was assaulted by three inmates in Sabarmati Central Jail shortly after his transfer. One attacker reportedly cited patriotism as the motive for the assault, which was quickly intervened by other prisoners. The incident has prompted an investigation into jail security and potential collusion.

title: Stop harassing them: Pak court orders police to stop troubling Indian woman who married local
content: A Pakistani high court has ordered authorities to cease harassing a 48-year-old Sikh woman who converted to Islam and married a local man after meeting him on social media. Sarabjeet Kaur, who went missing during a pilgrimage, petitioned the court claiming police pressure to dissolve her marriage to Nasir Hussain.

title: IND vs SA: 'Coach thodi jaake khel raha hai' - Ex-India cricketer backs Gambhir amid criticism
content: The Eden Gardens pitch for the India-South Africa Test sparked debate after India's batting collapse. Coach Gautam Gambhir defended the surface, stating it was as requested and playable. Robin Uthappa supported Gambhir, emphasizing the coach doesn't play the game and highlighting a double standard in pitch scrutiny between domestic and international cricket.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where is gold headed in coming days? Check rate outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may trade sideways in the coming days. The broader upward trend for gold remains intact. Silver is expected to remain volatile. Investors are watching for cues on US interest rate cuts.

title: Karisma Kapoor's children file a new plea against Priya Kapur
content: Karisma Kapoor's children, Samaira and Kiaan, have filed a new petition seeking to prevent Priya Sachdev from moving Sunjay Kapur's assets. The court will hear this request on November 20. Meanwhile, a dispute over the examination of Sunjay's original Will continues, with a response from Priya Sachdev due within three weeks.

title: India-US trade deal: No hiatus in ties; Goyal hints at ‘good news’ soon
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal indicated that a trade pact between India and the US is nearing completion, emphasizing the need for a fair, equitable, and balanced agreement. He assured that India will continue to protect the interests of its farmers, fishermen, and small industries during ongoing negotiations.

title: 6 warning signs of kidney damage from taking too much vitamin D
content: Excessive Vitamin D supplementation can lead to hypercalcemia, straining the kidneys and causing nephrocalcinosis, potentially resulting in acute kidney injury or failure. Early symptoms like nausea, thirst, and frequent urination signal critical electrolyte imbalances. Careful use under medical supervision and regular monitoring are crucial to prevent overdose and protect kidney health.

title: India's Eden debacle: Underprepared pitch, shoddy technique, lack of specialists - IND vs SA
content: India's debacle at the Eden Gardens against the reigning World Test Champions (WTC) in the first Test has raised a plethora of questions -- the team's preparation after playing a white-ball series in Australia, India batters’ dodgy technique against quality spin and the lack of specialists in the Test squad.

title: Viral clip shows LeBron James’ celebration as he returns for record 23rd season
content: Basketball icon LeBron James is back on the court, celebrating his record-breaking 23rd NBA season with an infectious happy dance. After a lengthy absence due to sciatica, the Los Angeles Lakers star's return against the Utah Jazz was met with widespread excitement.  Fans eagerly awaited his comeback, and James' joyful display perfectly captured his enthusiasm for the game.

title: CBSE Board Exams: Class 10, 12 subject-wise marks distribution released; check details
content: The CBSE has released the subject-wise distribution of marks for Class 10 and 12 board exams in 2026. Practical, project, and internal assessments will be conducted from January 1 to February 14, 2026. Schools are cautioned against mark-upload errors and advised to strictly follow the provided guidelines for a smooth examination process.

title: Historic! Population 1.56 lakh - Curacao becomes smallest nation to qualify for FIFA World Cup
content: Curacao has achieved a historic feat, becoming the smallest nation to ever qualify for the FIFA World Cup. Their draw against Jamaica secured their spot in the 2026 finals in the United States, Canada and Mexico. This remarkable achievement marks a significant moment for the Caribbean island. Elsewhere, Haiti also secured a World Cup berth after a long absence.

title: Paris alleges Michael's estate executors 'pocketed' USD 10 mn for personal gain
content: Paris Jackson has intensified her legal battle against her late father's estate, asserting that the executors have overstepped their authority and mismanaged finances. She alleges that more than $10 million was wrongfully appropriated in 2021, significantly overshadowing distributions to beneficiaries. Paris is concerned that the estate is being exploited for selfish interests instead of honoring Michael Jackson's legacy.

title: ‘Quiet, Piggy’: Journalist asks Trump about Epstein files; US President snaps
content: Donald Trump escalated his confrontations with women journalists, calling a Bloomberg reporter "piggy" and a "terrible reporter" to an ABC News correspondent. He accused ABC of "fake news" and urged regulators to "look at" revoking its license. The incidents renewed criticism of his treatment of female reporters.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ seen as revisiting Joe Alwyn breakup, not Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Taylor Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Didn’t want to return as ‘homosexuality not accepted’: HIV+ Syrian man held for overstaying
content: A Syrian national was apprehended in Gujarat for overstaying his visa by two years, reportedly to remain with his same-sex partner in Khambhalia. Both individuals are HIV positive.

title: Fully functional: Solid gold toilet fetches $12.1m at NYC auction; artwork was titled ‘America’
content: A solid gold toilet, Maurizio Cattelan's satirical artwork 'America,' fetched $12.1 million at Sotheby's New York. This 18-karat, fully functional sculpture, weighing over 220 pounds, previously gained fame at the Guggenheim and was famously offered to President Trump. The piece, a commentary on wealth, has a history including a dramatic heist where another edition was stolen and likely melted down.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 84,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was below 25,900, BSE Sensex was near 84,600.

content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

content: the "World's Most Famous Arena" is a popular venue for professional wrestling . it was the home base for the world wide Wrestling Federation when it operated out of the Northeastern United States under the old regional territory system . fans got a big title change, a hefty Survivor Series: WarGames title match announcement and three massive unannounced names returning .

title: UFC champion Makhachev heads welterweight uprising

title: '470 drones, 48 missiles': Russia's huge attack on Ukraine - Zelenskyy shares video
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Delhi brings out biohazard masks, cylinders to air its disgust
content: Koushiki Saha, a trainee journalist currently reporting for The Times of India, covers urban governance, infrastructure lapses, public grievances, and municipal policies with clarity and compassion. Still learning every day, she draws insights from fieldwork, lived experiences, and holding authorities accountable through persistent, people-focused reporting. Read More

title: ‘Doesn’t stare into camera’: Experts say Delhi bomber Umar’s video shows brainwashing

content: Partha, senior assistant editor (markets) at The Times of India, Mumbai, covers the financial markets, mainly the stock market, mutual funds, banking and insurance sectors. He is a sports enthusiast. His hobby is philately. title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: the Buffalo Bills (-4.5) visit the Houston Texans as road favorites on "Thursday Night Football" the late window features a matchup of NFC East rivals when the Dallas Cowboys host the Philadelphia Eagles . the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Los Angeles Rams close out the slate on "sunday night football"

title: Offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through start of spring training .

title: Let's talk about North Texas -- why the Mean Green is the bet to make in December
content: north Texas is sitting -115 both ways to make or miss the playoff . the committee is reacting to resumes, but not quality wins . UNT has one loss, a 63-36 defensive collapse to south Florida .

title: Week 12 Power Rankings: Oklahoma jumps into top 10; three new teams join the list
content: Texas still has a path to the College Football Playoff despite three losses . the Aggies left Kyle Field at 10-0 for the first time since 1992 . they have areas to improve as the most important games, including their first appearance since 1992, are ahead .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5’s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, if the big Ten likes it or not . a week-long playoff showdown between usC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .

title: O's acquire Ward from Angels for RHP Rodriguez
content: the Baltimore Orioles acquired outfielder Taylor Ward from the los Angeles Angels in exchange for right-hander Grayson Rodriguez . the 26-year-old was drafted no. 11 overall out of high school in 2018 . he posted a 4.11 ERA with 259 strikeouts against 78 walks in 23823 innings .

title: Who are the favorites for Tucker? Which teams will go all-in this winter? Passan's MLB offseason preview
content: the largest free agent contract the Pirates have ever handed out was more than a decade ago . the Pittsburgh Pirates were primed to spend more than twice that on Josh Naylor before he re-upped with Seattle for five years and $92.5 million in the first signing .

title: Solak: Let's rank the best coaching hires and find the good in the Seahawks' loss
content: a marquee week for benchings is in the books . it's a mark for last-second, winning plays, if you're into that . we'll look at what the biggest storylines mean and what comes next .

title: What we learned from Duke's win over Kansas at Champions Classic
content: the 15th edition of Champions Classic ended with wins for the Kentucky Wildcats and Duke Blue Devils . the Spartans ran away with a 17-point victory, and the no. 5 blue Devils sealed the 12-point win . ESPN's college basketball reporter Myron Medcalf and NBA draft analyst Jeremy Woo break down what they're taking away from a star-studded night in new york .

title: 🍼 Baker and wife Emily expecting baby No. 2
content: the couple have a daughter, Kova Jade, and will add a boy to the family . the couple broke the news with a gender reveal photoshoot as the two sliced a cake with blue coloring, indicating a baby boy .
